titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the World War II pictorial collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-02-14T15:59-0800

change.item: February 13, 2018: Added links to materials in the 2018 release of declassified records subseries that are available on digitalcollections.hoover.org. -Sally DeBauche February 9, 2017: Revised to include description of mFY by Paige Minister. April 21, 2015: Revised to make locations up to date. 2017 May 4: updated description by Helena Ong.

did.unittitle: World War II pictorial collection

physdesc.extent: 181 envelopes, 1 manuscript box, 1 oversize box, 3 album boxes, 2 slide boxes, 1 oversize folder

did.abstract: Photographs and postcards depicting a variety of scenes and personalities from World War II. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], World War II pictorial collection, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms Available
altformavail.p: Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Photographs and postcards depicting a variety of scenes and personalities from World War II.

did.unittitle: Photographs and postcards depicting various scenes from World War II
20 unidentified photographs of American soldiers in World War II, apparently taken in the Philippines
Photographs of German armed forces in Germany, Poland, Denmark, Norway, Russia and North Africa, and of the German home front,
German army photographs depicting activities of the German army in North Africa,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copies from originals held by Michael Tichy.

did.unittitle: Photographs depicting activities of American, British, German and Italian armed forces in Europe and North Africa
Photographs taken by the U.S. Navy depicting ships and activities of the U.S. Navy, mostly in the Pacific Theater
Photographs of British naval operations and of an inspection of naval forces by King George VI
Photographs of Prime Minister Winston Churchill with high U.S. and British naval officers and other officials,
Photographs of U.S. armed forces in Great Britain
Photographs of U.S. armed forces in the Pacific
Photographs of the U.S. Navy Public Relations Officers' Conference, Washington, D.C.,
Photographs of U.S. and British armed forces
Aerial photographs of military facilities at Londonerry, Northern Ireland
34 post cards of German SS troops on the Russian front
125 prints of German seamen, submarines and other ships, and of naval engagements
43 prints of German troops in France, Norway and elsewhere on the Western Front
6 prints of German troops in North Africa
9 prints of German troops in the Balkans
6 prints of Benito Mussolini and of German troops who rescued him from captivity,
21 prints of war damage, political activity and social conditions in Vichy France and in German-occupied France
93 prints of street scenes, buildings and war damage in Berlin
12 prints of U.S. Army Air Corps airplanes
12 prints of U.S. Navy airplanes
123 prints of German troops in Paris,
22 prints of Vichy youth organizations and miscellaneous scenes from Vichy France and German-occupied France
49 prints of the bodies of victims of German concentration camps at Buchenwald and elsewhere
32 prints of American troops entering Liege, Belgium
39 prints of war damage in Liege and other Belgian cities
10 prints of President Harry S. Truman in Brussels and Antwerp, Belgium, en route to the Potsdam conference,
22 prints of the entry of Allied troops into Antwerp, Belgium,
4 post cards of the entry of Allied troops into Tournai, Belgium,
16 prints of Tournai, Belgium, including scenes of war damage,
12 prints of war damage caused by V-1 and V-2 rockets in Antwerp, Belgium; map showing location of rocket attacks in Antwerp
29 prints of U.S. armored amphibious personnel carriers in action, mainly in the Pacific Theater
20 prints of posters and street scenes in German-occupied France
12 drawings of Allied troops in Belgium,
15 prints of unidentified ships, zeppelins, and barrage balloons
Graves of American soldiers in Great Britain (3 pages from photograph album); 72 prints of miscellaneous scenes and groups of people (possibly in Great Britain)
2 prints of Admiral Harold Stark with others; 1 print of Admiral Stark, Winston Churchill, and others; 2 prints of Winston Churchill, Admiral Stark, Harry Hopkins and others
15 prints of unidentified people and scenes
28 prints of Japan and Pacific Islands

13 prints of Japan and Pacific Islands; 12 prints of World War II aircraft; 1 print of Lt. Gen. Tomoyuki Yamashita; 1 print of Gen. Dwight D. Eisenhower and Gen. Douglas MacArthur; 1 print of Gen. Douglas MacArthur, Lt. Gen. Jonathan Wainwright and Lt. Gen. A.E. Percival; 10 miscellaneous prints
13 prints of Japan; 4 postcards of Japan; 1 print of Kunming, China; 1 print of Hawaii
34 prints of scenes in Europe
34 prints of scenes in Europe

18 prints of scenes in Europe; 6 prints of U.S. Army, University Study Center, Florence, Italy; 1 print of Secretary of War, Henry L. Stimson (July 4, 1944); 1 print of General Dwight D. Eisenhower (1944); 1 print of Pierre Laval, Benito Mussolini, and others (1944)

1 print of Gen. Geo. C. Marshall, Gen. Henry H. Arnold, Adm. Ernest J. King; 1 print of Harry S. Truman's headquarters, Potsdam, Germany (1945); 3 prints of Winston Churchill, Joseph Stalin, Harry S. Truman in Potsdam (1945); 3 prints of Harry S. Truman, Joseph Stalin, Clement Attlee and staff in Potsdam (1945); 1 print of Harry S. Truman, Joseph Stalin, James F. Byrnes, Vyacheslav Molotov, Adm. William Dr. Leahy in Potsdam (1945); 1 print of Franklin D. Roosevelt, Winston Churchill, and President Innonu of Turkey in Cairo, Egypt (1943); 1 print of W.L. Mackenzie King, Earl of Athlone and Princess Alice, wife of the Earl of Athlone; Pres. Franklin D. Roosevelt and Winston Churchill in Quebec, Canada (1943); 1 unidentified print,
115 prints designated "Specimen of British War Literature," 1 print of Charles de Gaulle and others, 1 print of Winston Churchill and others

72 prints designated "Specimen of British War Literature;" 1 print of Omar Bradley, George Patton, and Dwight D. Eisenhower; 1 print of Dwight D. Eisenhower and others; 1 print of Nicholas Horthy, Prince Regent of Hungary with U.S. Maj. Gen. John E. Dahl; 1 print of Gen. George C. Marshall; 4 miscellaneous prints of war in the European Theatre
2 prints of German soldiers
75 prints of German and Japanese troops,
8 prints of forced labor in Norway, Poland, and elsewhere in German-occupied Europe
15 prints of starvation, food lines, and German regulations relating to food in Belgium, Norway, Poland, and Greece

73 prints of resistance activities in German-occupied Norway, Belgium, France, Poland, Yugoslavia, and Greece, including scenes of guerilla activity, sabotage, underground presses, and passive resistance
8 prints of German executions and concentration camps in Norway, Belgium, France, Poland, and Yugoslavia
11 prints of persecution of Jews in Poland
12 prints of the German invasions of Poland and Norway, and of German proclamations
9 prints of miscellaneous scenes of the German occupation of Belgium and Poland
8 prints of resistance activity in German-occupied Norway, Poland, and Yugoslavia, including scenes of guerilla activity and passive resistance
13 prints and 3 cartoons of conditions in German-occupied Norway, France, and Yugoslavia, including scenes of German executions, forced labor, and looting
2 mounted prints of German troops arresting civilians in German-occupied Europe
1 mounted print of a child in German-occupied Europe
5 prints, 5 charts and 1 cartoon from German-occupied Europe, depicting atrocities, food shortages, forced labor, and sabotage
21 prints of refugees and resistance activities in German-occupied Europe and of an exhibit in the U.S. on resistance movements attended by Eleanor Roosevelt
14 prints of a wartime exhibit in the U.S. on resistance movements in Europe
121 prints of refugees, executions, and resistance activities in Poland
83 prints of refugees, atrocities, and resistance activities in Greece and of Greek sailors in exile
5 drawings by children in France supporting French resistance activities
31 prints of French refugees, of resistance activities in Corsica and elsewhere in France, and of the scuttling of the French fleet at Toulon
11 prints of executions and resistance activities in Czechoslovakia
18 prints of resistance activities in Belgium and of martyred Belgian resistance members
13 drawings of resistance activities in the Netherlands
11 prints of war shortages and resistance activities in Norway
5 prints of resistance activities in Norway
11 prints of executions and resistance activities in Yugoslavia
23 prints of executions and resistance activities in Yugoslavia
73 French post cards, depicting Free French, British, and other Allied military, naval, and aerial forces
40 German post cards, depicting Waffen-SS troops on the Eastern Front
77 U.S. Army Signal Corps prints depicting scenes at the Nuremberg trials, disposal of German poison gas weapons by American occupation forces, and American troops in Europe at the end of the war,
27 color slides of Axis and Allied propaganda posters
64 prints depicting Belgian underground resistance fighters in German-occupied Belgium during World War II, and of Allied troops entering Brussels in September 1944
28 prints depicting Polish émigré politicians, statesmen, military personnel, establishments and buildings,
130 prints depicting scenes in Warsaw and other parts of Poland during World War II
138 photographs depicting various French Resistance units while under formation, during period of instruction, and in action

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Some were taken after the liberation of France; they refer to German atrocities committed against members of the Resistance as well as against the civilian population, celebration of the liberation, and General De Gaulle's visit to former resistance centers.

did.unittitle: 521 prints in 2 albums detailing the service of an unidentified Luftwaffe bomber officer, including the Polish campaign, the Channel Coast, and the Russian Campaign,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes close-ups of aircraft; general views of Luftwaffe airfields and quarters; war damage in Poland, France, and Russia; and various personal family shots.

did.unittitle: 131 prints depicting social conditions and activities of German Nazi party officials during World War II, with emphasis on Gauleiter Fritz Waechtler of Bavaria
265 prints depicting war damage in Berlin at the end of World War II
Photographs (1 booklet and loose prints) of the city of Braunschweig in central West Germany before and after destruction during World War II
1 album of prints depicting the funeral of R. Heydrich (1904-1942), Reich Protector for Bohemia and Moravia
56 prints depicting conditions at the Breendonck concentration camp in Antwerp, Belgium, during World War II
7 prints depicting conditions at the Buchenwald concentration camp in Germany,
90 prints taken by a Hungarian soldier in a Hungarian unit of the German Army during the German invasion of Russia,
4 prints depicting General Tomobum (Tomoyuki) Yamashita upon his arrival in Manila for his trial as a war criminal,
53 prints depicting the Philippines during and following the Allied invasion, including 3 prints of general MacArthur and 1 print of the surrender proceedings on Luzon,
12 prints depicting war damage to various buildings in Manila, Philippines,
117 prints depicting areas and events before, during and following the battle of Okinawa,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes two maps depicting Japanese mine fields, roadblocks, and other military installations in December 1944 and March 1945.

did.unittitle: 4 prints depicting the surrender ceremony on the U.S.S. Missouri in Tokyo Bay,
5 prints depicting activities in the China-Burma-India Theater,
16 prints depicting V-E Day in Paris,
41 prints depicting various aspects of the surrender of the German Navy under the supervision of the Allied Control Commission, in Flensburg,
52 prints depicting war damage in Coblenz, Frankfurt-am-Main, Goettingen, Hamburg, Hanover, Hochst, Kiel, Mainz, Neumuenster, Wesel, and Wiesbaden,
211 prints depicting war damage in Berlin,

2 autographed prints of Admiral Chester W. Nimitz at the signing of the Japanese surrender on board the U.S.S. Missouri and one photostatic copy of the signature sheet of the surrender document autographed by Admiral Nimitz,
5 prints depicting war damage in Nuremberg, Germany
24 prints depicting the visit of Eleanor Roosevelt to Great Britain,
5 prints with negatives showing various aspects of German fortifications on Normandy Beach
4 prints pertaining to the destruction of Caen, Normandy
1 print depicting U.S.S. Grayback coming into Midway for repairs
7 prints of the German surrender documents (Flensburg, Reims, and Berlin),
10 prints depicting the public hanging and burial of Benito Mussolini,
24 prints depicting Poland during World War II and 4 negatives depicting Jews being rounded up in the Warsaw Ghetto
6 prints depicting Yugoslavia during World War II
One album of prints, signed by Zhukov, depicting an exhibition in Leningrad for a dedication to Dwight D. Eisenhower during World War II
17 prints depicting various aerial battles over Europe during World War II
64 prints depicting Iron Cross recipients, and German air, ground and naval activities, including Bulgaria, Greece, France, and the Soviet Union

24 prints depicting German-Italian relations; the Romanian State visit to Berlin in 1940; and German, Italian, French, and English leaders including Hitler, Goering, Seyss-Inquart, Mussolini, Italian Foreign Minister Count Galenzzo Ciano, Philippe Pétain, and Winston Churchill

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Also included are 3 prints of the German Western front (Siegfried Line).

did.unittitle: 9 prints depicting the German domestic front and German war production including physical fitness for prospective troops

7 prints depicting a variety of scenes including the British Free Masonry in Berlin, the flight of Soviet citizens, the destruction of Soviet cities, the training or Allied troops, and the Japanese occupation of Shanghai
5 prints depicting England in German character, illustrated in cartoon style; 1 print of the Italian Air Force
42 prints depicting mainly scenes of the Sino-Japanese War and of daily life in Japan, especially war preparations by the Japanese Army and population at large,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Issued for the most part by the Japan Press Illustration Service.

did.unittitle: 3 prints depicting ceremonies of surrender of the German Army at Reims and Cordon in France and in Berlin; 1 print depicting Gen. Sir Bernard L. Montgomery; 1 print depicting Lt. Gen. Sir Edmond Schreiber; 1 print depicting Gen. Charles de Gaulle; 1 print depicting Gen. George C. Marshall talking to American soldiers in Germany, accompanied by Major General Raymond O. Barton and Major General Leonard T. Gerow; and 1 print depicting American soldiers inspecting a German tank destroyed by the advancing Third U.S. Army in Eastern France,

23 prints depicting Allied prisoners of war in Germany and Italian prisoners of war in Egypt engaged in various sports and board games facilitated by the War Prisoners' Aid Committee of the YMCA, and employees of the Committee packing items at the Geneva Office in Switzerland
20 prints of the ceremonial signing of the Japanese surrender on the U.S.S. Missouri,
4 prints of Adolf Hitler and Benito Mussolini attending a military review; and 1 print of Italian Partisans in Turin,
1 mounted print depicting the raising of the Soviet flag over the Reichstag in Germany with caption in Russian,
15 prints of scenes of naval warfare in the Atlantic Ocean and of American naval construction,
Prints of the Japanese surrender at the end of World War II,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes an autographed print of Gen. Douglas MacArthur and a print of an American bomber in India (1942).

did.unittitle: Photographs of Todd-California Shipbuilding Corporation,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains photographs of the visit of Viscount Halifax and other scenes of the Todd-California Shipbuilding Corporation from preconstruction to 1941.

did.unittitle: Declassified U.S. government records,
2018 release of declassified records,
